Grout is a substance designed to seal areas between tiles.

Grout is a thin, dense fluid which is used to fill gaps or used as reinforcement in existing structures.

Grout is a porous material used to fill gaps or used as reinforcement in existing structures.

Grout is a dense fluid which is used to fill gaps or used as reinforcement in existing structures. Grout is generally a mixture of water, cement, and sand and is employed in pressure grouting, embedding rebar in masonry walls, connecting sections of pre-cast concrete, filling voids, and sealing joints such as those between tiles.

Mastic is a viscous substance that is used to seal or fill small gaps or to adhere one surface to another.

Caulk is a material used to fill gaps or cracks. Caulk is used to seal joints or seams against leakage in various structures and piping.
Caulk is a substance designed to seal a joint between two surfaces in a bathroom or kitchen.
Caulking is both the processes and material to seal joints or seams in various structures and some types of piping.
A tile is a thin object usually square or rectangular in shape. Tile is a manufactured piece of hard-wearing material such as ceramic, stone, metal, or even glass.
